website_summaries.verdict: Long shank on the individual drivers provides plenty of torque to remove those tough nuts.
pros: With 7 different drivers, you're sure to find one that will match the size of nuts you're using
You'll like the 6-inch shank on each piece to give you the power needed for tough jobs
Socket sizes range from 3/16 to 1/2 inches
Includes magnetic tips in sockets to help keep track of loose nuts
cons: Shallow depth on the sockets may not provide enough grip on large nuts

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the HVAC trade, Love them!
customer_reviews.text: New to the HVAC Trade? This is the set you need, throw them in your cart and keep it moving. This set along with your supply house thermostat screw driver are probably the tools you'll be grabbing the most. I thought I could replace both of these with that slide driver two in one tool, but these drivers can get into places that the other driver can't. So I removed the slide driver and put both of these in my Veto TP4 service pouch. They're Klein, that means quality, and these drivers don't disappoint. I've had zero issues with them and they perform flawlessly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Bad set or decline in quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this klein nut driver set for 10yrs in my hvac job and typically I have to replace them every 18-24 months but this last set needs to be replaced already and it’s only been 7months. Hoping it was just a bad set and Klein isn’t cheaping out on the quality of its tools. Gonna give it one more chance and will change my rating if they last.
customer_reviews.author: Tim 2 the point

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because I needed both tools to replace a water inlet valve inside my washing machine. I figured the parts and tools would be much cheaper than having a repairman come out to fix it for me. They worked perfectly and the magnetic feature was the best part! I was afraid of dropping things down into or under the washer and being unable to complete the repair on my own, but these tool were simply fantastic and held the tiny pieces securely until time to put them back after I replaced the valve. Now I have 2 excellent tools in my collection for my next home repair job! Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra O

customer_reviews.title: Not the Klein Tool quality you expect to add to your tools.  Light weight
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lack of quality in the set I received. This could be a copy of the real thing. It sure does not feel like a quality Klein tool, more of a cheep knock off. I have other Klein tools, that far exceeds the build quality of this nut driver set I received. The nut driver feels light weight in your hands, not the heavy weight true feeling of a Klein tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxx

customer_reviews.title: Great set. Make sure it fits your needs!
customer_reviews.text: This set is well made and cushioned quite nicely. I got the set as a warehouse deal and they arrived in perfect shape. My only warning to you is to make sure you won't need a longer screwdriver or a larger selection of sizes before you purchase this set. Since I've had them, there are several times I wished I had an extra few inches in length (insert pun here) and some of the in-between sizes. I work on all types of machinery and electrical equipment, from kids toys to heavy duty industrial machines, and the only time a klein product has disappointed me is when I bought the non contact voltage tester.
customer_reviews.author: Markie Twain

customer_reviews.title: Success!
customer_reviews.text: I had a short nut driver that wasn't serving my purpose. With this tool and some WD40 I finally removed a nut holding the front panel on my old clothes dryer. One nut came off with my existing tool, but the second required this extra effort. Turns out it wasn't inserted properly. Removing a crooked nut is a task! In the end my efforts were rewarded. As I suspected, this area of my dryer was caked with lint. A definite fire hazard!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Carter

customer_reviews.title: The extra long shaft makes these worth the price of admission imo
customer_reviews.text: Are these expensive? I think so BUT I couldn't find this long of a shaft anywhere else - so I paid the price. I must admit they are really nice quality. The handle is a bit cushiony giving you awesome grip and although I haven't used them yet most people can tell a quality tool just by how it feels in your hand..... Seriously though- if you need the best nut drivers out there I believe Klein has you covered.
customer_reviews.author: Mc Lovin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tools, hollow shafts.
customer_reviews.text: I like the deep hollow shafts and the extra overall length of these nutdreivers over several others I have considered. I have an inexpensive shorter set but they don't have deep hollow shafts and that can be a problem for some electronics work I do. If these holds to the same quality standards Klein is known for, they will provide many years of service and I have no doubt that they will live up both the reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kemper

customer_reviews.title: and these nut drivers are great. I bought these for an old
customer_reviews.text: Klein tools have remained my tools of choice for 40+ years, and these nut drivers are great. I bought these for an old, retired man's hobby of replacing the webbing on aluminum lawn chairs, and I should have bought the shorter shaft nut drivers. But, I'm keeping these, they work great, and I'm looking for a chance to use them where I need long shafts!
customer_reviews.author: William M. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: The quality is what u expect from Klein comfortable, and durable with a strong magnet
customer_reviews.text: As an HVAC Tech this is a how did i do the job before i had these. The answer is very frustrated and fumbling with screws. For any tech who may need to get a screw to the back of a box through stuff winding all over or down a long way in a hole you cant beat these. The quality is what u expect from Klein comfortable, and durable with a strong magnet. The hollow center really adds to this because it enables you to take nuts off of long bolt in hard to reach areas. This is a must buy for any tech you wont be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and long reach - Great for HVAC and appliances
customer_reviews.text: Perfect weight for a long driver with a much needed magnetic chuck (use with Hex head Tek screws etc) Great for all HVAC work, appliances, sheet metal work, etc. Best price available that we've found.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great feel in your hand. Only gripe and it’s small is I wish the socket on the driver was a touch thinner to fit better. Overall not bad though, feels good and comfortable in your hands
customer_reviews.author: mxusa8383

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Service Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought these a long time ago! I am an HVAC technician and these things are a lifesaver. The magnetic tips were a big selling point for me because I am always dropping screws and the magnets are very strong. Also the long shaft makes it much easier to get into hard to reach places. The hollow shaft is awesome because it makes it work as a deepwell socket would, allowing the nutdriver to not bottom out on the threaded shaft of a nut. The handles also provide a great grip. All around awesome tool to have as a Technician.
customer_reviews.author: SWY11389

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tools
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent tools. They have a hollow shaft that is 7 1/4" deep. The magnetic ends hold screws and nuts very well with no problems. The handle comfortable when in use. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: J.Q.

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic? NOPE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set so looking forward to it. Nice an new, handles grip nicely; but they are NOT magnetic at all! The item description said they were; but they are not! I need magnetic for my work and this was a mistake. I can't afford $50 mistakes; so I am very upset. Should've kept my old ones
customer_reviews.author: "Yo, ToolBox!"

customer_reviews.title: Nice tools
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for years. Eventually the size numbers wear off and the handle rubber begins to slip. They last a long time and are still usable though.
customer_reviews.author: airtight_python

customer_reviews.title: It's a KLEIN
customer_reviews.text: For the most part the name KLEIN says it all quality US built tools. Over 20 years in construction of some sort and I've had very few Klein tools that I've had an issue with.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Harris

customer_reviews.title: Strong, well built drivers.
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Strong and well built. The pass-through shaft is nice to have. These are a must for any home mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Suminski

customer_reviews.title: Trust Klein and worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Trust Klein just because some of my current tools have been "bit" line voltage and i didnt feel a thing. Bought these due to the hollow shank. Just beefing up the ole tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: HVAC guy

customer_reviews.title: HVAC tec using every day
customer_reviews.text: I use these every day cant wear them out but they do get lost. So I always buy the same never had a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: MovedToTN

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful set of nut drivers
customer_reviews.text: Originally, when i boggy them. I thought they were the magnetic set, so when they arrived i was dissapointed. But after using them i liked them so much, i practically forgot about the set that is magnetic
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Klein product as usual! Love the extra reach and the pass through magnet
customer_reviews.author: c.j.

customer_reviews.title: You can finally reach those nuts with these.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hvac techs for those hard to reach nuts. It's bad when you cant reach your nuts.
customer_reviews.author: gmb

customer_reviews.title: Hvac must have!
customer_reviews.text: No matter what your working on these two are always gonna the most common sizes! And the magnetic heads make your job way easier in tight spaces. The rubbers on the handles are nice and stout that makes it pretty effortless to tighten or loosen up. Haven't had no issues with it since I got them.
customer_reviews.author: RedFox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools
customer_reviews.text: I've used these screwdrivers for years now. Awesome product because of the magnetic tips. No more dropped screws, getting lost and falling out. Plus, the long shanks get deep in hard to reach areas with limited space, especially electical controls compartments. Very durable. Comfortable in the hand. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Kamaris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pair of tool to have in your arsenal
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding pair of nut drivers. I'm an electrician and been in the trade over ten years. Have worked in live panels for years and have always had to be extra careful installing and removing breakers from live panels. With these magnetic nut drivers though, it makes it so much easier. Excellent pair of tool to have in your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: a.carreno

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought years ago
customer_reviews.text: It's Klein, it's flawless. No more cursing dropped hex head screws. Extra length saves cutting hands on sheet metal enclosures from reaching deep inside.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These tools are awesome. I repair pool and spa heaters for a living. The long neck on these drivers allow access to the hardest to reach spaces. The grip on the handle is great. I often have oil on my hands but I'm still able to grip. Delivery was as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: What can you say
customer_reviews.text: They are nut drivers. They drive nuts. Magnets work great. Comfortable. Just gotta use some putty to get the schmo out of the tips from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: V. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Two of the best tools in my tool bag.
customer_reviews.text: Spend the extra money for the magnetic nut drivers. I hate using my non magnetic ones now after owning two sets of these. Got these for the extra reach into electric panels and they are my Go To for all 1/4 and 5/16" head screws. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph and Bugsy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Made well
customer_reviews.text: Nice set that allows the threaded rod to go into the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jlvbert

customer_reviews.title: Tool bent and dented.
customer_reviews.text: Was not happy with this. 1/4” tool was bent and dented. Amazon will replace. Disappointed with the quality of product. Very expensive, was expecting more from a reputable brand like Klein.
customer_reviews.author: Robb J. Passante

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For HVAC
customer_reviews.text: If you work in HVAC you need these. The magnetic tips are perfect, especially for some of those tight spaces on furnaces. Plus the quality is great. I also would recommend the 610M set too. (I included the link)
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great set of you don’t have the multi tool but driver set then grab these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: klein tools made in china 2018
customer_reviews.text: just received 2 klein tools today, they are cheaper than 4 year old kleins, we weighed them at our shop today 1 tool is 5 grams lighter and the other is 7 grams light, this seller should know klein has outsourced or has made them thinner and say so, I am returning today and going on a mission to find some new old stock, a lot of companies have made stuff thinner, maybe flag down the snap-on truck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Shallow heads will not grab an acorn nut. hollow shaft maybe , but not 'over screw' , actually back to the shallow heads, I ordered 5/16 and 1/4 pair. the heads are /.140" to .160" deep, not much to work with. Well made but worthless to me.
customer_reviews.author: harold weaver

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat em
customer_reviews.text: I dint realize how worn my old set of Klein nut drivers had become, after 18 years of use its nice to have some new ones, better grip and better fit on the screws, will still be using the old ones in my second backup tool pouch. When it comes to tools of the trade don't go cheap go quality!
customer_reviews.author: Ty B

customer_reviews.title: Easy ordering and fair price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product.. use em every day ... easy to order and fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Used to demonstrate class
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, during my training class, as instructor I was able to disassemble a furnace fast and easily
customer_reviews.author: premier620

customer_reviews.title: Long shaft nut drivers.....Because size does make a difference :)
customer_reviews.text: Prior to buying these 6 inch shaft nut drivers I have been using the Klein 3 inch drivers I bought when I was an apprentice.....30 yrs ago! OUY cannot go wrong with Klein, as always they produce great electrical tools and stand behind their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Hard To Impress

customer_reviews.title: Use these every day.
customer_reviews.text: Use these every day. Wish there was a simple way to get rid of the metal shards that stick to the magnets over time
customer_reviews.author: Ibuy itall

customer_reviews.title: Nutdriver Set
customer_reviews.text: Very nice nut drivers in the sizes I most commonly use, with a longer than typical shaft which allows better access in some situations. 4 star rating as the first set I ordered, the magnet in the 1/4" driver was not fully seated on one side. This caused any nut / screw placed into the driver to not sit evenly. Exchanged for a replacement, and the replacement set is good.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: They are a very good tool. I have used them for many years
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about Klein tools that most of us don't already know. They are a very good tool. I have used them for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Klein = durable and high quality.
customer_reviews.text: They are Klein nutdrivers, they are as expected durable and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Get em
customer_reviews.text: Great set of nut drivers, the long shanks make them so much more handy than the short shank ones in my opinion. Coworkers borrow mine constantly on the job and all like them as well, solidly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Must have for electricians
customer_reviews.text: Awesome nut drivers that are magnetic, every electrician needs these
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: My screws do not jump anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Good size keys. The magnetic system holds screw for safer use. Good grip. My screws do not jump anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Eduardo Honorato Silva

customer_reviews.title: great for working on HVAC units where the longer reach ...
customer_reviews.text: They're Klein, great for working on HVAC units where the longer reach is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Badger 305

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA!!
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I have wiha metric nut drivers and now have Klein imperils not drivers. Only thought it was right to have my imperial nut drivers made in the USA. Very please with these so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jb1234

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic ends make a huge difference in convenience during my electrical work. Long shaft allows easy access inside equipment and cabinets. The shaft is also hollow if you are threading a nut onto a bolt, the bolt will not bottom out on your tool. Klein has great quality, a little pricey though.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love these nut drivers. I have been a mecganic for 40 years, i have snap on and mac and craftsman. And these are tops every time i reach into that drawer and get one. Great grip for me and the most comfortable .
customer_reviews.author: patrick verrillo

customer_reviews.title: Best nut drivers I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Great drivers. I deal with a.c. systems everyday and these drivers really help. The magnetic tips are great. The long shafts help get to bolts that are hard to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Klein quality! Perhaps the best in the industry.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes your basic economy tools aren't good enough. If you depend on these hand tools to earn your living, there are none better than Klein. Yes, there are plenty of tools that have a "lifetime warranty" but the fact is, Klein tools rarely have to go back for replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Cant go wrong with Kline. If your a service technician or electrician you know the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set of drivers. Must have to reach hard to get to places. I'm an HVAC tech and these come in handy when working with furnace drains.
customer_reviews.author: Galen Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Great buttttt....
customer_reviews.text: Very handy in most applications, especially for HVAC work - typical Klein quality and fast shipping. One major complaint though, the hollow shaft is too small for the usual size bolt in a 5/16 nut. With a slightly bore they would be absolutely perfect for heating work in ceiling mount hotboxes.
customer_reviews.author: MaintenanceDave

customer_reviews.title: Magnet cracked in Pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I got those in Oct/2017 the magnet is one of them cracked in pieces in Aug/2018, I used those for only 20 time and can not exchange it or return it.

customer_reviews.title: The MUST HAVE tool for HVAC work.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what else needs to be said - these belong in everyone's HVAC bag - High quality, made in the USA, get's the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great set of drivers
customer_reviews.text: IF you have these two sizes they cover 90% of the average jobs you will encounter in HVAC repair. The magnetic tip prevents you losing your nuts which is always a plus! Cushion/insulated grips and great price, you can't beat it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Klein, what more can be said! Made in the USA!

customer_reviews.title: Small change
customer_reviews.text: Wish the red color on the end of the handle was more pronounced for indicating the 1/4 inch nut driver and dito with yellow on 5/16. Would make identification in semi light areas easier. other than that, its hard to screw up a nut driver!!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality! I use these all day, every day. Three and a half years and the magnets are still strong, grips are still good, sockets still tight. I have recommended them to my co-workers. Worth every penny!

customer_reviews.title: Get value
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic end holds the screws in place and the hollow shaft allows you to get bolts that are hard to get to.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

product_meta.title: Klein Tools 647 Hollow Shaft Nut Driver Set with Chrome-Plated 6-Inch Shafts and Cushion Grip Handles
product_meta.description: Style:Non-Magnetic| Size:7-PieceKlein Tools 7-Piece Cushion-Grip Nut Driver Set contains the type of nut drivers professionals carry most often. Each nut driver features a full hollow shaft for work on stacked circuit boards or other long bolt applications. Klein's patented Cushion-Grip handle provides greater torque and comfort. Internal flanges provide solid, twist-resistant shaft anchor. For more than 160 years, Klein Tools has manufactured premium-quality, professional-grade hand tools that deliver the performance, durability and precision needed to get the job done right. Our family of engineers, workers and craftsman continue to put six generations of expertise into every tool we create by using only the highest quality materials, superior workmanship, and keeping manufacturing as close to home as we can. Klein isn't just the name of our company, it's also our family name. And since we're an American company that's family-owned and family-run, you know you can count on us to be here tomorrow. Klein Tools doesn't just make great products, we make great products that stand up to the demands of the professionals who use them every day ... Since 1857.
